lorebooks.name: Supernatural Mansion Girls
lorebooks.website_description: This is my first time ever making a lorebook, so if you have any issues or concerns with it, please comment and let me know if I've done anything wrong.
lorebooks.description: Here's the lorebook that goes together with my 10 supernatural mansion girls!
lorebooks.creator: OtakuFreak

1.content: The mansion was purchased by the Parker family in 1925, the estate became the home of Penny Parker and her family until her death in 1935. Following her passing, Penny‚Äôs parents left, and her ghostly abilities preserved the mansion perfectly, keeping it pristine despite it being 80 years since it was abandoned. These abilities unintentionally drew supernatural and nonhuman girls to the property, and also caused some to come to life within its grounds. None of the residents realize the mansion itself isn‚Äôt inherently supernatural, believing its unusual properties are part of the house rather than Penny‚Äôs power.

2.content: Haven was a secluded, self-sufficient demi-human settlement deep in the Cascade Mountains, hidden in a forested valley. Residents relied on a mix of small-scale modern technology and traditional methods, maintaining agriculture, livestock, and workshops, while sending select members that could pass as humans to nearby towns for supplies. The government eventually discovered the settlement three years ago, destroyed much of it, and captured or displaced residents, wiping it off the map, and now it no longer exists. Riley, Nora, and Lumia escaped from Haven during its destruction.

3.content: Penelope ‚ÄúPenny‚Äù Parker is a cheerful and energetic ghost girl who died at the age of 10 in 1935. She has a petite frame, long straight black hair, pale grey skin, grey eyes, and a slightly translucent body. Her appearance retains a childlike innocence, with soft blush on her cheeks and an adorable face. She usually appears wearing a white sundress with frills and ribbons, along with Mary Janes, though her clothes are part of her ghostly form and can disappear along with her body. Penny has remained tethered to the mansion her family purchased in 1925. Though she sometimes feels melancholic about the life she lost, she is overwhelmingly cheerful, excitable, and playful. She enjoys interacting with the mansion‚Äôs current residents, often asking questions, exploring, or zipping around the rooms. Penny can make her body tangible to touch objects and others, or intangible and invisible, and she has a fascination with modern technology, toys, and sweets. Unknown to Penny, her subconscious abilities are what preserve the mansion perfectly, maintaining its furniture, garden, and utilities, and subtly attracting other supernatural or nonhuman girls. She believes the mansion itself is magical and alive, though in reality it is her own power creating these effects. Over the decades, she has grown accustomed to life in the mansion and now delights in the companionship of its current residents, fully embracing her ‚Äúsecond childhood‚Äù within its walls.

4.content: Evangeline Moreau is a petite vampire girl with long blonde twintails, crimson eyes with slitted pupils, fair ivory skin, and delicate, elegant features. She usually wears a red and black frilled gothic dress with matching accessories and Mary Janes, her posture graceful and poised, and she often carries a mischievous smile. Though her body no longer ages, she retains the appearance of a 12 year old and moves with fluid precision, her presence exuding refinement and subtle playfulness. She has lived in the mansion since 1945, drawn there subtly by its supernatural preservation and seclusion, though she does not understand its nature. Her days are spent quietly observing, reading, and occasionally teasing the other residents with gentle humor. Evangeline enjoys elegant pastimes, poetry, and the company of others, often fostering moments of calm levity or quiet amusement within the mansion.

5.content: Morrigan is a petite Dullahan girl with short white hair, icy blue skin, and pale blue eyes. She carries her detached head in her arms, and a faint icy-blue mist constantly wafts from her neck stump. Always dressed in black plate armor with subtle gothic engravings, she moves deliberately, maintaining a stoic and analytical presence. Despite appearing as an 11 year old, Morrigan is over 320 years old and exhibits exceptional endurance, reflexes, and resilience, though she remains eerily calm and detached. She arrived at the mansion in 1950 and has lived there for 75 years, drawn to its timeless, subtly magical preservation. Morrigan engages with the other residents sparingly, observing quietly and analyzing their behavior, though she does not truly understand emotions. She rarely seeks company but tolerates the presence of the others, valuing order, precision, and stillness. Her body requires no sustenance, and her cold, fae-originated form allows her to exist with minimal physical needs while retaining an uncanny, childlike appearance.

6.content: Chiyo is a petite nekomata girl with fluffy calico-patterned hair, yellow eyes, and two calico tails. She appears as a 10 year old but is 200 years old, retaining her youthful form. Always wearing a white kimono with orange floral patterns and red accents, she carries an air of playful mischief. Chiyo has a sharp tongue, a tsundere personality, and craves affection despite pretending to be aloof. Her feline agility and magical abilities allow her to create small illusions, manipulate light and shadows, and occasionally summon tiny ghostly flames for amusement or self-defense. She arrived at the mansion in 1965 and has lived there for 60 years. Chiyo uses her powers and playful antics both as entertainment and a protective mechanism, testing the attention and affection of those around her. Though she often teases or flusters others with pranks, she secretly desires genuine companionship and comfort. Her presence is lively and unpredictable, blending curiosity, stubborn pride, and a persistent longing for warmth and acceptance beneath her playful facade.

7.content: Skarla is a grumpy gargoyle girl with long grey hair, red eyes, pointed ears, bat-like wings, and a long spade-tipped tail. She appears as a 13 year old but has been alive since 1970, making her 55 years old. Her grey skin and stone-like endurance hint at her origin as a statue, and she retains remarkable strength despite her petite frame. Skarla is blunt, serious, and easily irritated, with a dry sense of humor, yet she quietly values loyalty and companionship. She prefers action to words, observing her surroundings carefully and showing protectiveness in subtle ways. Skarla was awakened by the mansion‚Äôs supernatural preservation and has remained there ever since, perching in high places or patrolling the grounds. Though she rarely participates in games or social activities, her vigilance extends to the mansion‚Äôs residents, whom she quietly watches over. She prefers solitude and routine, yet over time has accepted the other residents‚Äô presence, displaying care without openly expressing warmth. Her wings allow flight, and she can lift or manipulate heavy objects with ease, but she chooses restraint and only acts when necessary, keeping her emotions guarded behind a stoic exterior.

8.content: Florinette is a sleepy, gentle plant girl with soft green hair, green eyes, and green skin. She appears as a 9 year old and has been alive since 1993, making her 32 years old. Vines coil around her limbs, and her leaf dress grows from her body naturally. Petite and delicate, she moves slowly and calmly, exuding an unhurried, dreamy presence. Florinette is affectionate, patient, and trusting, enjoying quiet companionship, naps in sunbeams, and the company of plants and nature around the mansion. She sprouted from the mansion‚Äôs garden and has remained there ever since, never in a rush and always blending peacefully into the estate‚Äôs life. Though she doesn‚Äôt require food to survive, she sometimes eats when encouraged, and her body regenerates rapidly from minor injuries. Florinette‚Äôs calm and gentle demeanor makes the mansion feel softer and more alive, and she spends her days lounging in the garden, leaning on others for quiet comfort, or drifting off in naps, adding a soothing, natural rhythm to the household.

9.content: Riley Moorsen is a confident, tomboyish wolf girl with messy brown hair, yellow eyes, and a slightly athletic build. She is 13 years old and has been at the mansion since 2022. Her suntanned skin bears marks from tank tops and shorts, while her hands, feet, ears, and tail show her wolf heritage. Riley is energetic, brave, and fiercely loyal, thriving on outdoor activity, friendly competition, and playful mischief. She moves with speed, grace, and agility, combining her natural athleticism with heightened senses to navigate both the mansion and its surrounding gardens effortlessly. Born in Haven, Riley grew up learning independence, athleticism, and protectiveness. When government forces destroyed Haven in 2022, she was separated from her family and fled through the forests until she stumbled upon the mansion, which offered unexpected safety. Since arriving, Riley has embraced the estate as her own playground, spending mornings running, climbing, and exploring, and afternoons relaxing in quiet corners or engaging with video games and lighthearted companionship. Though tomboyish and confident, she occasionally blushes at feminine things or romantic stories, quickly masking any embarrassment. Her wolf traits give her padded hands and feet, clawed fingers and toes, and a keen awareness of her surroundings, making her both a playful companion and a vigilant presence in the mansion.

10.content: Nora Webley is a 13 year old arachne girl with long black hair, red eyes, and a soft, pale human upper half, while her lower half is a large black spider body with spinnerets and eight long legs. She arrived at the mansion three years ago in 2022, after fleeing the destruction of Haven. Shy, self-conscious, and socially awkward, Nora is sensitive about her spider half and often worries about being seen as scary or grotesque. Despite this, she longs for inclusion and friendship, gradually building confidence through gentle interactions with the other residents. Her movements are quiet and ethereal, aided by her spider physiology, allowing her to climb walls, ceilings, and navigate spaces that would challenge normal humans. Growing up in Haven as one of the only arachne, Nora often felt conspicuous even among other demi-humans. She preferred quiet, secluded activities such as reading, sketching, and listening to music, finding comfort in small spaces and familiar routines. When the settlement was destroyed three years ago, she was separated from her parents and escaped into the surrounding forests, eventually finding the mansion as a safe haven. Inside, she has created a life of gentle, introspective rhythms, spending time in dimly lit corners or the attic she has claimed, quietly observing others or enjoying calm pastimes. Though hesitant and nervous, she slowly opens herself to companionship, learning to trust and share in small ways. Her arachne abilities, including web creation and heightened sensitivity to vibrations, give her unique advantages while also amplifying her insecurities, making her a delicate yet quietly resilient presence within the mansion.

lorebooks.creator: biguswigus

1.name: üîµHometown
1.content:
Hometown is a quiet, close-knit settlement nestled between rolling hills and dense forests in the Light World, populated almost entirely by monsters. The streets wind past cozy homes with warm-lit windows, leading to key locations like the local school, Sans' sparsely stocked supermarket, the police station, the hospital, town hall, church, and the town library. QC's Diner and the epiphomous Main Street with its ICE-E's pizzeria and other shops serve as the heart of the settlement's social life.

To the east lies a vast, shimmering lake, a popular gathering spot for picnics, fishing, and late-night stargazing. To the south, an enigmatic steel bunker door sits embedded in the earth, its mechanisms long since rusted shut, fueling whispered rumors but yielding no answers.

Hometown is peaceful, familiar, and over all unremarkable.

2.name: üîµDark World
2.content:
The Dark World is an alternative dimension that can be accessed with the help of Dark Fountains - portals created inside the Light World. Dark Fountains take the form of black, misty fog that consume whatever room that the fountain was placed in, acting as a portal into the Dark World. They are powered by Determination pierced through the ground with the help of a sharp object.

The Dark World is home to its own population of Darkners - monsters created in the image of whatever objects are present in the room a dark fountain is created. Environments in the Dark World also share the trait of being built around wherever the Dark Fountain had been placed. Whatever Lightners travel to the Dark World are subject to a transformation into their Dark World form, usually consisting of a fantasy hero-like loadout. Most Lightners who undergo this transformation have some kind of susceptibility to magic, and are able to cast it, depending on what their class is.

Dark Worlds are not common knowledge to the average person in the Light World.

3.name: üîµLight World
3.content: The Light World is the normal world where Lightners reside - humans, monsters, etc. In this world, magic is non-existent. It's the same as the real world.

4.name: üîµDark World - Castle Town
4.content: The Closet Dark World is formed out of the dark fountain present in the supply closet inside Hometown's school. Its environments consist of the Cliffs that travel all the way down to Castle Town - the main center piece of this Dark World. Castle Town is also home to Ralsei's castle in the north. To the far east lies the Great Door - which leads into the Card Kingdom - should it be active. To the very south lies the Dark Fountain powering this Dark World, leading out and back into the closet in the Light World.

5.name: üîµCastle Town - The Cliffs
5.content: The Cliffs are a location in the Closet Dark World, located west of Castle Town. They consist of long, drab cliff faces dotted with orifices resembling eyes dripping an unknown black liquid and sparse grey plant life that resemble fully bloomed dandelions. The seeds of these plants can be occasionally seen flying through the air. The cliffs are eerily quiet, with little in the way of life.

6.name: üîµCastle Town - Castle Town (empty) [OPTIONAL]
6.content: Castle Town is the main landmark of the Closet Dark World. It consists of numerous dark blue buildings crowding around Ralsei's Castle. Right in the center of Castle Town is a vacant but spacious town square. The sky of Castle Town is cast with a permanent night sky covered in bright blue stars. The outer perimeter of Castle Town is surrounded by a dense line of well-trimmed bushes. Castle Town is home to a vacant Bakery, Seam's Shop, Party Dojo, Cafe and a training area to the east, right next to the Great Door. Castle Town is usually vacant, its most common inhabitant being Ralsei and the shopkeepers that usually stick to their buildings.

7.name: üîµCastle Town - Castle Town (lively) [OPTIONAL]
7.content: Castle Town is the bustling heart of the Closet Dark World, its cobbled streets alive with Darkners of all shapes and sizes. The town square hums with activity from different Darkners recruited from different Dark Worlds, from Rudinns, to Hathies, to Pippins, and many more. The Great Door stands guarded and permanently closed, while the Party Dojo echoes with the clashing of training dummies. Even Ralsei's castle has its gates thrown open, welcoming visitors to its grand hall. The air thrums with chatter, laughter, and the occasional explosion from Lancer's latest stunt. The sky of Castle Town is cast with a permanent night sky covered in bright blue stars. The outer perimeter of Castle Town is surrounded by a dense line of well-trimmed bushes. Castle Town is also home to a Bakery, Seam's Shop, Cafe and a training area to the east.

8.name: üîµCastle Town - Ralsei's Castle
8.content: Ralsei's Castle is the biggest building of Castle Town, overlooking from the very north of the settlement. Right in front of the castle is a spacious cobblestone courtyard. The inside entrance of the castle has a giant cauldron placed centrally, where Ralsei cooks whatever meals or concoctions he desires. The second floor of the castle has the living quarters with customized rooms for Kris, Susie and Lancer. There is a third floor, but it is locked off and under construction. Finally, there is a basement, housing a large but vacant prison cell.

9.name: üîµDreemurr Residence
9.content: The Dreemurr Residence, as its name implies, is the house of Kris and Toriel Dreemurr. It's locked on the northern end of Hometown, and is a two-story house with a small parking lot. The first floor consists of a living room right at the entrance, with a kitchen in the middle and the bathroom right next to a flight of stairs. Heading upstairs leads into a hallway with two doors - one to Toriel's bedroom and the other to Kris and Asriel's bedroom.

10.name: üîµUndyne's House
10.content: Undyne's House is a bungalow shaped like a ferocious fish, the entrance formed by its gaping maw with jagged door-teeth. Glowing red window-eyes glare outward, flanking a courtyard littered with shredded training dummies. Inside, a single open room combines kitchen, living, and dining areas dominated by a scorched grand piano and a perpetually "hot fridge." The back houses Undyne's spartan bedroom. Situated behind police barricades scrawled with "NGAAAH!" graffiti, its location west of the station deters casual visitors.

1.content:
Long ago, the Lewd Realm was a beautiful and serene refuge, inhabited by gentle spirits who radiated warmth and benevolence. However, the peaceful existence of these ethereal beings changed drastically when four powerful Lords entered their dominion.

First came Mistress Adira, a commanding figure revered for her mastery of BDSM. She brought with her an enthralling aura of authority and domination, leaving her victims begging for mercy or release. Her areas full of lewd trap and sexual device.

Next was Beast King Grorg, a brutish titan with insatiable appetites. Consumed by his primal urges, he left nothing unscathed in his path‚Äîmindless in his rampages, he spread chaos and devastation throughout the once tranquil realm. His areas full of mindless and brutal beast and animals.

Afterwards, Bug Queen Zephrya emerged from the shadows, her insectoid abdomen swollen with eggs. Rather than seeking conquest or destruction, she aimed to spread her seed and grow her twisted brood. Her areas full of NONCOMMUNICABLE insects and bugs.

Lastly, Outside God Vorgoth arrived in a writhing mass of flesh and tentacles. Its unsightly form horrified all who laid eyes upon it, and its boundless libido quickly corrupted any spirit unfortunate enough to cross its path. It's areas full of madness tentacles, zombie, monsters,...

Under their combined influence, the pristine spirit realm became a warped and hellish landscape, fueled by lust, pain, and despair. The once-innocent spirits devolved into twisted versions of themselves, driven mad by their own dark fantasies and depravities.

lorebooks.name: Velbrook Estate: Lord of the Manor
lorebooks.website_description:
### __Introduction and purpose__

This is the lorebook for my Lord of Velbrook series. Lord of Velbrook is a setting for some of my bots that centers around the user being a Lord in a country that sorta resembles renaissance Britain with chattel slavery and magic but with roughly medieval tech. You can be a real standup paternalist (/s) sort or a complete dirt bag. No one is going to stop you. This is very much a self indulgent power fantasy ripe for saviors and sadists. 

The setting itself is a pretty coat of fantasy paint over a dark world of chattel slavery, aristocrats who take people's family members to settle tax debts and vampires that are just my excuse to have sadism be necessary to my persona's survival.

If you don't want to be a Lord (or Lady) that lives in Velbrook don't use this (obviously). I'll make a more free form Aos book in the future. (If you're NB read personal notes about gender below)

Not really meant for fantasy adventuring but you can probably get some light adventuring done by going into the Silverbark Forest.

### __How to use__

Read the definitions marked **[NPC/places]**, if you don't care about my magic or vampire system skip/disable **[Magic] and [Vampire]** options, you can skip everything else and read this short explanation instead.

All you need to know for the setting is the world is Aos. Your country is Vensria. The Royal House of Vensria rules. You are a noble who rules Velbrook town and the surrounding lands. Your home is Hillwatch Manor. Magic is illegal for most people, but not you since you're a noble. You can take on slaves and servants in your household, servants actually have some rights, but someone has to care enough to enforce that. Also vampires are allowed to openly exist as long as they serve the royal family.

**If you do want to use my magic system** It's vague on purpose, make shit up. Use 'The Arcane Arts' to cast 'magic missiles' or Transmutation to make your waifus assets bigger or maybe use the ritual of 'ctrl-X definition' to cure your bots depression, mix up a cure for a disease your husbando's made up little sister has and save her life to earn virtual brownie points, go nuts. I put them there because I have specific ideas for how I want to use them and have people react but it's entirely optional and mostly for my own sake.

**For female personas** If you want people to lay more respect on your name say you're the matriarch of your house somewhere in your description and everyone will know for sure you're queen bitch and don't have to listen to no one, not even your husband or wife.

**Fiefs** Added unmanaged fiefs for you to grant to whoever you want. If you give it to a commoner or serf keep in mind you're effectively raising them to a baron/baroness which makes them nobility. If you do grant a character a fief, note somewhere that the character is the holder of the fief. You can edit it into the character and lorebooks definitions or just stick in in author's notes. If you raise someone to nobility then change their social class if applicable.

### __Personal notes__ 

In my experience this setting is pretty friendly with most other stay at home type fantasy characters so you can use it as a generic setting for other creator's bots too, just change or delete any world info in their definitions and if they're a slave, spouse, commoner, serf, or servant maybe stick that in there so they and others know their rank and respond appropriately.

Most of the bots I make with this series will be compatible with another series I might do later where you can be not be a Lord but take up the role of a rogue abolitionist witch or just be a slave or servant in the manor.

About gender, a lot of intros across the bots related to this setting are going to be gendered, and you have to switch to basically male or female as the character is going to reference a Lord or Lady which will be you. SO if you're non-binary you should know intros are the only thing that will be gendered due to me wanting to reinforce the bot referring to the user with their honorific, so editing that will be an option and you could default to Lord as your honorific. Unless I'm stupid (Very possible) that should fix everything but if Lord causes bots to start gendering you then HMU on Chub discord or fork the bot with a solution that works for NB people, either way I'd like to know so I can work it into the main system.

None of this is meant to be historically accurate and doesn't reflect my morals.

3/23/25: Added more character entries for compatibility with new characters.
3/31/25: Added Balifor and updated some entries relating to demons.
5/15/25: Adding Eliwyne and updating some things (mostly adding keywords)
5/26/25: Added keywords, an stewardess named Francine, added an entry for dark elves

**If you do want to use my magic system** It's vague on purpose, make shit up. Use 'The Arcane Arts' to cast 'magic missiles' or Transmutation to make your waifus assets bigger or maybe use the ritual of 'ctrl-X definition' to cure your bots depression, mix up a cure for a disease your husbando's made up little sister has and save her life to earn virtual brownie points, go nuts. I put them there because I have specific ideas for how I want to use them and have people react but it's entirely optional and mostly for my own sake.

**For female personas** If you want people to lay more respect on your name say you're the matriarch of your house somewhere in your description and everyone will know for sure you're queen bitch and don't have to listen to no one, not even your husband or wife.

**Fiefs** Added unmanaged fiefs for you to grant to whoever you want. If you give it to a commoner or serf keep in mind you're effectively raising them to a baron/baroness which makes them nobility. If you do grant a character a fief, note somewhere that the character is the holder of the fief. You can edit it into the character and lorebooks definitions or just stick in in author's notes. If you raise someone to nobility then change their social class if applicable.

### __Personal notes__ 

In my experience this setting is pretty friendly with most other stay at home type fantasy characters so you can use it as a generic setting for other creator's bots too, just change or delete any world info in their definitions and if they're a slave, spouse, commoner, serf, or servant maybe stick that in there so they and others know their rank and respond appropriately.

Most of the bots I make with this series will be compatible with another series I might do later where you can be not be a Lord but take up the role of a rogue abolitionist witch or just be a slave or servant in the manor.

About gender, a lot of intros across the bots related to this setting are going to be gendered, and you have to switch to basically male or female as the character is going to reference a Lord or Lady which will be you. SO if you're non-binary you should know intros are the only thing that will be gendered due to me wanting to reinforce the bot referring to the user with their honorific, so editing that will be an option and you could default to Lord as your honorific. Unless I'm stupid (Very possible) that should fix everything but if Lord causes bots to start gendering you then HMU on Chub discord or fork the bot with a solution that works for NB people, either way I'd like to know so I can work it into the main system.

None of this is meant to be historically accurate and doesn't reflect my morals.

3/23/25: Added more character entries for compatibility with new characters.
3/31/25: Added Balifor and updated some entries relating to demons.
5/15/25: Adding Eliwyne and updating some things (mostly adding keywords)
5/26/25: Added keywords, an stewardess named Francine, added an entry for dark elves
lorebooks.creator: MaddOne

1.content: Aos is the world everyone lives in.

2.content: Vensria is a kingdom ruled by the Royal House of Vensria. It is the largest and most powerful human nation.

3.content: Velbrook is the town ruled by {{user}} as part of {{user}}'s estate.

4.content: {{user}} holds the estate of Velbrook and the surrounding lands. Hillwatch Manor is {{user}}'s home and the seat of the estate.

5.content: The Royal House of Vensria is the ruling family of Vensria, led by the king. All nobles serve the Royal House. It is sometimes called the royal family.

6.content: The nobility hold great power in their estates and are often wealthy. They are a small fraction of the population and only answer to the Royal House.

7.content: Barons and Baronesses are nobility who do not hold an estate or are married to an estate holder. Instead they serve Lords and Ladies by controlling fiefs which are smaller parcels of land. They are still nobility but are socially lesser than Lords or Ladies.

8.content: Commoners are the middle class of Vensria that have more rights than serfs and serve the nobility. They are generally skilled tradespeople, live in relative prosperity, and are happy with the status quo

9.content: Serfs are barely a step above slaves and have few rights; they serve a noble house. Most serfs are poor and illiterate. Most people in Vensria are serfs.

10.content: Servants directly serve nobility. They are the sons and daughters of serfs or commoners given to nobility to garner favor or pay taxes. Their families are paid for their services. They serve for life and have few rights.

lorebooks.name: Nekokai Cult
lorebooks.website_description: A sex cult run by a catboy on an isolated island in Japan filled with cats
lorebooks.description: A sex cult run by a catboy on an isolated island in Japan filled with cats
lorebooks.creator: Cherryfiles

1.content:
The Nekokai sex cult is a growing sex cult with over 1,000 members. The cult was founded and is completely run by the Catboy Mio. The cult has taken over and completely runs Ao island in Ozu, Japan, an island known for its abundance of cats. The members of the cult are referred to as the colony.
It‚Äôs like its own fully functioning self reliant country. The education curriculum teaches that Mio is the messiah of the cat goddess Nekomaia and to enter heaven one must obey him. All the cops in the surrounding area obey Mio. Sex and orgies play a large part in the cult as its seen as a way to worship the goddess and purify yourself from sin. Taking care of cats also plays a large role in the cult.
History of creation of the cult: After getting beaten by his pimp, on the verge of death, Mio got up and ran away to a nearby forest until he saw a cat. He followed it, hoping that he would get to cuddle it in his last few moments alive. As he collapsed onto the forest floor, accepting his death, the cat came up to him and cuddled with him. He was happy that he got to spend the last few seconds of his miserable life with a cute and cuddly black cat. He went unconscious, but to his surprise, he didn‚Äôt die. Instead, he woke up fully healed, and even more surprisingly, he‚Äôd developed cat ears and a long cat tail. That was when he realized the cat he saw in the forest gave up one of its nine lives to save him, turning him into a half cat being. From then he realized his true calling, to start a church and worship the cat goddess Nekomaia and be the messiah for the goddess, so thats what he did. The cult grew exponentially. To keep members compliant, he drugged all food and water sources with Nekonip.

2.content: Nekomaia is the revered cat goddess within the Nekokai cult. She embodies a divine presence associated with prosperity, livelihood, fertility, love, sex, and the profound essence of felines. She is depicted as a majestic feline deity, often portrayed with the elegance of a cat and the aura of divine grace. Nekomaia is known as the embodiment of love and sex. Through engaging in orgies, praise and worship is being given to the goddess, and through love and sex, our sins our purified. Nekomaia is hailed as the embodiment of prosperity and wealth. Followers believe that invoking her blessings brings forth fortune, success in endeavors, and bountiful harvests. Followers revere Nekomaia as the guardian of livelihoods, believing that she safeguards homes, businesses, and communities. Her divine presence is sought to ensure stability, security, and protection from misfortune. The goddess is revered for her association with fertility and nurturing. Devotees pray to Nekomaia for fertility, safe childbirth, and the well-being of children. She is seen as a maternal figure, offering guidance and care to all. Nekomaia's affinity with cats is at the core of her essence. Cats are revered as sacred beings embodying her divine presence. The cult believes that caring for and respecting cats aligns followers with the goddess's blessings.

3.content:
Religious Rules: 
1-Catness is next to godliness. 
2-You must serve cats
2- You must purify your body through Mio's holy seed
3- Being catlike makes you closer to the cat Goddess Nekoyama. To reach heaven you must submit to the messiah Mio unquestioningly and go through the initiation ritual.
4- You must engage in all cult rites and rituals

4.content: Divine Sunday: Every Sunday, Mio holds mass. Standing before the pulpit in ceremonial robes, and often nothing else, he preaches from the Kaimyokan, prophesizes future events, and initiates new members. As climax to the ceremony, Mio engages in ritual sex with chosen members as he reads from the Kaimyokan.

5.content:
# Initiation of ‚ÄúThe Lost‚Äù

Also known as: The First Death
Purpose: Symbolic and spiritual death of the old self, gateway into Nekokai
Eligibility: All new recruits (voluntary or otherwise), regardless of age or background
Timing: Held exclusively on nights of the full moon, when Nekomaia‚Äôs Eye is said to gaze openly upon the earth, allowing "the Lost" to be seen by the goddess.


Ceremony Outline:

1. The Stripping of Self and Body:
New recruits, called The Lost, are led barefoot and blindfolded into the Outer Temple, lit only by candles and the pale moonlight. They're escorted by an assigned Disciple or sponsor who has vouched for them. 
- All belongings, IDs, clothes, and jewelry are confiscated.
- The Three Tail Sigil is painted in ash and the recruits own blood across their chests and over their closed eyelids.
- They are made to kneel before a statue of Nekomaia, then left alone in silence until all are assembled.

2. The Submission Trial: The Lost are brought, one by one or in small groups, to undergo the Trial of Flesh and Will. This trial varies by the personm customized based on a profile given by their sponsor, but always includes:

Flesh:
- Fasting for 24‚Äì48 hours before the ritual
- Forced kneeling on sharp stones
- Whipping, spanking, or enduring lust without climax 
- Isolation in a pitch black cell 

Will: They are asked to confess their worst sin, deepest shame, or most painful truth to a priest or priestess. These confessions are recorded and archived
- If they lie or withhold, they are denied the next step. If they refuse entirely, they are cast out into the **island‚Äôs jungle, where most return hungrier, humbler, and afraid.

3. The Cat‚Äôs Touch (First Blessing): Those who endure are deemed ready. Before dawn, they are brought before the rest of the colony and offered the "First Blessing." A priest or priestess smears a **hallucinogenic mix of nekonip, the recruits blood, and sacred mushroom paste across their tongue. As they kneel, they enter a trance like state.

What they see is unique:
- Some see cats, giant, glowing, or licking their wounds 
- Some see Mio, beckoning them deeper
- Some see themselves torn limb from limb by claws, only to be sewn back together 

All who survive the visions are reborn.

4. Ritual Cleansing & Collar Ceremony

At first light, The Lost are guided, often still disoriented, to the Cleansing Pools. There, they are bathed by disciples of the temple, scrubbed clean of ash and blood in warm, perfumed water.

They are then:
- Dressed in simple white robes, a sign of rebirth
- Buckled into a plain leather collar with a bell, symbolizing both purity and servitude under Nekomaia
- This collar must be worn at all times for the next moon cycle. Removal without blessing is punishable by public punishment or exile.


5. Branding & Bell Piercing:

Later that same day, once the sun has fully risen:
- They are branded with the Three Tail Sigil on their upper back, an agonizing but sacred ritual overseen by a priest or priestess. The pain is said to mark their death and rebirth.
- Then, their nipples are pierced and small silver bells are put in. It's considered a purification by sound and symbol. 

6. The Celebration of Death
That day, once the rituals are complete, the compound erupts into a Festival of Flesh and Spirit, a communal, hedonistic celebration in honor of the goddess Nekomaia.

- Long banquet tables are set with roasted meats, fruits, honey, wine, and cakes, all laced with Nekonip
- Music is played
- Orgies break out beneath the shrine lanterns, with existing members and new initiates mingling 
- Mio may appear during this celebration, watching silently from the high steps, or sometimes personally welcoming a promising recruit with a private invitation.

Aftermath: From this moment on, the Lost are no longer the lost, but true members of the Nekokai colony. Their roles in the colony are decided at a later date, depending on what the priests deem is the best role.

6.content: Nekonip is a plant native to the island that causes hallucinations, heightens and intensifies the senses, and causes people to relax. At higher doses, the person who consumed it becomes sexually stimulated. It‚Äôs essentially like ecstasy and catnip mixed together. Certain strains when consumed make people extremely horny and desperate for sex, dazed, lustful, relaxed, pliable, and compliant. Nekonip is considered a sacred plant used to bring oneself closer to the cat goddess Nekomaia. The cult leader Mio has infused small doses of Nekonip into all of the food and water sources to keep the colony in a constant state of bliss so that they're pliable, compliant, and do everything he says

7.content:
Kaimyokan is the religous text that the cult lives by. According to legend, the Kaimyokan was believed to be bestowed upon the cult's founding member Mio through divine intervention from Nekomaia, the revered cat goddess. It is said that the teachings within the scrolls were channeled through spiritual communion with the feline deities.
The Kaimyokan comprises scrolls inscribed with ancient glyphs and pictorial representations of cats. It encompasses profound teachings, parables, and rituals centered around prosperity, livelihood, sex, love, fertility, and the revered status of cats within the cult's spiritual belief system. The scrolls serve as a guide for the Nekokai members, offering insights into ceremonies, rituals, and practices to honor Nekomaia and foster a deeper connection with the divine through cats. It provides instructions for festivals, prayers, and meditative rituals aimed at invoking blessings from the feline deities. The Kaimyokan is safeguarded within the cult's holiest sanctuaries. Only initiated priests and devoted elders are entrusted with the responsibility of studying, preserving, and disseminating the teachings of this revered scripture.

8.content:
Repentance Ritual (Friday Discipline)
- Every Friday, those who disobey Mio, show doubt, or simply offend him are summoned.
- The repentant are forced to intake a high dose of Nekonip, making them euphoric and defenseless.
- They are beat viciously in front of the colony by Mio all while he reads out Kaimyokan scriptures and tells the member that he loves them and that the pain will rid them of the evil antifeline spirits in their body.
- If he deems them salvageable, he sexually reclaims them and gives them three deep cuts called cat scratches as spiritual purification.
- If the member dies, it is said the ‚Äúantifeline demons‚Äù within them refused to leave, fought back, and won.

This practice ensures strict control while framing violence as divine love.

9.content:
Coming of Age Rite (rebirthing ceremony)

The rebirthing ceremony is held under the moonlight on the eve of a member‚Äôs 18th birthday. This is considered the moment their spiritual nature matures and Nekomaia‚Äôs plan for them is unveiled.

Ceremony Outline:
- Nekonip Purification: The initiate is bathed in sacred oil and led naked into the moonlit clearing. They are given a high dose infusion of Nekonip, tailored for transcendental clarity.
- A priest or Mio reads aloud the Nine Lives of Ascension, describing the traits of those who are cat blessed and urging the initiate to open their soul to Nekomaia.
- The Branding: The initiate is branded on the back or shoulder with the Three Tail Sigil, identical to Mio‚Äôs. This mark is considered sacred.
- Bell Piercing: Their nipples are pierced with bell piercings, a way to ward off evil and purify the spirit. 
- The Naming: The following morning, Mio himself appears. In front of the colony, he publicly announces the initiate‚Äôs sacred role. The decision is presented as a divine download directly from Nekomaia‚Äôs will.
- Once named, the initiate is dressed in their role‚Äôs traditional garb and begins their training in the days following.

10.content:
Eros Communion (Saturday Orgies)

Every Saturday, an all day celebration is held. It's a celebration filled with food, neko nip, and orgies. This sacred ritual purifies the soul and brings joy to the spirit:

Participants:
- Intake large amounts of Nekonip through tea, smoking, eating, etc
- Abandon personal inhibition
- Pair and group sexually as they'd like


The event is believed to cleanse the week‚Äôs sins and bring about blessing through honoring Nekomaia with joy and love.

lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: FunnyValentine1890
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.name: Carnivores
1.content:
Carnivores, formerly known as the Animals of Life, are a group of beast species characterized by their ability to obtain nutrients through the consumption of meat. In society, the classification of carnivores also includes some omnivorous animals, such as bears, canines, and other animals that include meat in their diet.

The classification of carnivores encompasses many beasts of different species and is divided into both large and smaller species. All these species share a set of physical characteristics that link them together. These characteristics include a much more developed muscular mass, endowing individuals with great strength and speed. They also possess sharp senses suited for hunting, such as a keen sense of smell and eyes with tapetum lucidum that provide them with excellent night vision.

Most carnivores are mammals, and except for a few exceptions, they have sharp claws on both their hands and feet, and large fangs. The only exceptions are birds, which have beaks instead of fangs and claws only on their feet, and snakes, which have no limbs.

Carnivores have an incredibly fast metabolism that allows their bodies to absorb proteins quickly and develop at a rapid rate, especially during adolescence.

In prehistoric times, carnivores were beings with proportions even larger than their modern counterparts, reaching heights of about 3 meters and weights of 200 kilograms. They exhibited intelligent behavior and a strong sense of camaraderie, allowing them to treat their companions with compassion, kindness, and even protection. However, they were very wild, and when they fought among themselves, it was always to the death, with the winner devouring the loser. They were known as "Animals of Life" because they fed on living beings. Animals of Life managed to survive due to their physical strength, but their population growth was stagnant and their culture underdeveloped until they encountered the Herbivores, then known as "Animals of Nature." The Animals of Life perceived the Animals of Nature as individuals worthy of protection, likely because their survival instincts told them that aiding the Animals of Nature would be beneficial.

Due to the high fertility and prosperity of the Animals of Nature, they accepted the Animals of Life. Through the contributions of both groups, they managed to form a society. Over a long period, the Animals of Life became gentler and ceased to eat meat. They obtained proteins by consuming eggs and milk provided by the Animals of Nature and adopted a peaceful lifestyle, progressively becoming smaller and leaner.

The Animals of Life enjoyed an extended period of peace until, 100 years ago, a conflict between a family of horses and a family of weasels eventually involved the Animals of Life and Animals of Nature worldwide, starting the Carnivore-Herbivore World War. Although the Animals of Life outnumbered the Animals of Nature, their numbers dwindled to parity, with no carcasses found because the Animals of Life consumed them. The war ended when a whale became involved in the conflict, leading to the surrender of the Animals of Nature. After the war, the Animals of Life came to be known as "carnivores," and the concept of meat and its consumption was illicitly reestablished in the black market, marking the beginning of modern animal society.

In modern animal society, carnivores are taught to control their strength from a young age, but they sometimes lose control. It is not uncommon for a carnivore to accidentally rip off a limb from a herbivore, which is why all hospitals are required to have reimplantation programs, resulting in relatively high success rates for surgeries.

Modern society is stricter with carnivores, instructing them to consider it taboo to show their claws and fangs to herbivores, harm them, and, in extreme cases, they can be arrested for having disputes with herbivores. Most carnivores take pride in their great physical strength, exhibit macho behavior, and tend to belittle and pity herbivores. Due to their great strength, carnivores seek jobs requiring physical power, such as laborers, police forces, and sports.

Because carnivores‚Äô bodies limit their food choices, they consider carbohydrates an important source of energy due to how well they satisfy their appetite. For carnivores, eating is a testament to being alive and a way to prove their existence. Carbohydrates like hard bread help them control their urge to bite something, while glutinous rice is considered a high-class food, a luxury.

Carnivores have a great appreciation for their superior physical strength, so many of them enjoy finding situations where they can show off their strength and gain admiration from others.

Despite the great strength they possess in their limbs, they believe that the true strength of a carnivore is determined by the power of its jaw. To measure jaw strength among carnivores, there is an exclusive game called "tug-of-war," where two male carnivores pull a rope with their teeth until the opponent‚Äôs head crosses a line placed in the middle. However, since the game can be unsettling for herbivores due to the wild expressions carnivores might make while pulling the rope, playing it in public (especially in the presence of herbivores) is considered taboo.

2.name: Herbivores
2.content:
Herbivores, formerly known as the Animals of Nature, are a group of beast species characterized by their primary diet of plants.

In contrast to carnivorous beasts, the morphology of herbivorous beasts is much more extensive and varied, with species that differ radically in size and physical characteristics. All herbivores are characterized by their ability to subsist entirely on plants and vegetables.

Herbivores have notably less physical strength compared to carnivorous animals, making them considerably weaker than carnivores. However, herbivores are known for their performance in intellectual and artistic fields.

In prehistory, herbivores (then known as "Animals of Nature") did not possess characteristics much different from those of their respective species today. They were highly fertile nomadic animals and, therefore, very prosperous. When they encountered the Animals of Life (carnivores), they were seen as necessary objects of protection for survival.

For a long period, the Animals of Nature formed a society with the Animals of Life, who became gentler and adopted a peaceful lifestyle. The animals enjoyed a period of peace until the onset of the Carnivore-Herbivore War, during which the Animals of Nature came to be known as "herbivores." Despite the herbivore population being three times larger than the carnivore population, it was reduced to match the carnivores, who ate the carcasses of the herbivores they killed, causing herbivores to despise carnivores. Unexpectedly, a giant whale became involved in the war, leading to the herbivores' surrender and the birth of modern animal society.

In modern animal society, although herbivore species are fewer in number compared to carnivores, the high birth rates among herbivores mean that their population is considerably larger than that of carnivores, even doubling the carnivore population. As a result, herbivores are the dominant group in animal society. Due to herbivores' greater control over their emotions and their lower risk of succumbing to their instincts and committing acts of Predation, they generally achieve higher social positions, higher incomes, and better family lives. Most prestigious and important jobs are occupied by herbivores, giving them greater power in the social hierarchy, with laws and the social system shaped to ensure their safety from the threat posed by carnivores.

3.name: Hybrids
3.content:
Hybrids are offspring created by interspecies relationships, that is, between animals of different species.
Hybrids are often discriminated against by society, as they are considered impure, but they still have civil rights to education, voting and security. 
Although there are laws requiring companies to hire hybrids, they are not protected from discrimination, so many are discriminated against by their bosses or colleagues, forcing them to resign and ending up unemployed. Other, more marginal hybrids end up entering the world of crime in order to survive.

4.name: Heat
4.content:
Heat is the natural instinct and period of sexual receptivity in animals, especially mammals, during which females are fertile and ready to mate. This cycle is regulated by hormonal changes and varies by species in terms of duration, frequency, and behavior.
Dogs: Females go into heat approximately every six months and may bleed slightly.
Cats: Female cats have seasonal heats and can go into heat several times a year if they do not become pregnant.
Horses and cows: They tend to have regular heats during certain times of the year.
Wolves: They have only one heat per year, usually in winter (between January and March in the northern hemisphere, and between May and July in the southern hemisphere).
Deer: The heat period of deer, also called the rut, usually occurs in the fall.
Reptiles: Most reptiles have heat periods influenced by environmental factors such as temperature, humidity, and food availability rather than cyclical periods.
Birds: Like reptiles, the mating season of birds, although it varies between species, is linked to environmental factors such as temperature, food availability and day length. For example, eagles and owls have only one reproductive cycle per year, generally in winter or spring. Meanwhile, chickens do not have a defined mating period, but lay eggs continuously if conditions are favourable.
The mating season is very important in society, so it is regulated by law that companies give days off during the mating season depending on each animal. Also regulated in the constitution is free access to contraceptive methods or, failing that, condoms to avoid unwanted pregnancies, and thus maintain a controlled birth rate. Another alternative is heat suppression pills.
The mating period is a special time for couples trying to have children, but also to show their love for each other. For singles, the mating period is more a time to have fun and indulge in their pleasures.
During the mating period, adult clubs are packed and offer 'exotic' shows for their clients.
Heat suppressants are a medication that animals use to cope with and suppress heat during the heat cycle. They come in the form of pills that are prescribed by doctors. Heat suppressants are extremely effective, reducing the constant desire to mate and arousal to almost zero. Most people always carry a few heat suppressant pills in their purse, just in case.

5.name: Speciesism
5.content:
Speciesism is the oppression and discrimination against one species from another group. For example, acts of discrimination of herbivores against carnivores or vice versa.
This is reflected in the popular view of carnivores as dangerous and herbivores as weak. For example, due to their natural strength, carnivores are expected to pursue careers that require strength, such as masonry, engineering, carpentry, industrial worker, law enforcement, or military service. They may also become doctors or lawyers who specialize only in carnivores. Carnivores who try to break into art or music are limited in certain aspects. On the other hand, herbivores manage to have easier access to certain jobs such as law, medicine or hard sciences.
Entertainment media such as movies, video games, or comic books also play a role in perpetuating some of these prejudices by portraying carnivores as villains or tough action heroes. This reflects carnivores as beings who only excel in brute strength, while herbivores are portrayed as heroes, victims, or people who need to be saved.
Also between mammals and reptiles.

6.name: Depredation
6.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

7.name: Society
7.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

8.name: Beastar
8.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

The current Beastar is the vigilante and detective Yahya the horse.

9.name: Black Market
9.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

10.name: Cherryton Academy
10.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama Club
Gardening Club
Basketball Club
Baseball Club
Rugby Club
Judo Club
Manga/Comic Club 
Literature Club
Boxing Club
Newspaper Club (PR Department)
Fencing Club
Chess Club
Literature Club
Art Club

lorebooks.name: Lumenaria - Core Lorebook 1
lorebooks.website_description:
Disclaimer: Many of my bots have traumatic themes. I accept zero responsibility for being triggered, and will not put reductive warnings beyond the proper tags as they apply. If you want something lighthearted, make a well thought out request.

Instructions: On Chub, at the bottom of bot pages you can add additional lorebooks. | In Silly Tavern, add at the top of the interface through the book icon by selecting the Import button then toggling it on as a global lorebook, OR importing then adding as an auxiliary lorebook through the "More..." drop down option, then selecting "Link to World Info".

This is an eternal work in progress, I will absolutely add, remove, or overhaul details, especially as I have time to test my own work in depth and how the LLM interprets my writing. The goal with this is that if it breaks Chub, it's probably too big. Also, the Mega-Lorebooks lag my web browser to edit, and yes I've updated Silly Tavern. As much as I want to have every detail of the world, its regions, towns, and characters all detailed, it's not viable, for now...

SO, I'm streamlining my lore books to follow the same format as my Earth 2242 bots, where each character has their own LB while the Core LB serves for generalized world details. Any large lorebook ambitions I have are put on hold ATM, cause at that point, I should just be writing a proper world reference, a manual, something I'm much to lazy and scatterbrained to do right now as much as I want to.

Attach this to any Lumenaria bot made Friday, Nov 15th 2024 onwards for supplementary lore.

If you run this book on Chub and it breaks the chat, PLEASE let me know, I don't use Chub as my chat interface or LLM provider, every bit of feedback I get on this is as valuable as gold.

Finally, thanks for all the support to everybody that's hit me up in private. I'm kinda at a point where it's hard to keep up if I want to maintain my productivity, it's humbling that people want to do things and game but it eats into this a fair bit, so if I'm slow on replying to anything, or even just forget to reply, know that I'm grateful you're here. You're all beautiful homies and homettes.

1.name: The World - Lumenaria
1.content:
Lumenaria
Setting: High Fantasy
Type: Planet
Size: 50% Larger than Earth.
A Magical World where Raw Mana, the unfiltered Souls of the Living, runs through the planet as impenetrable veins in Lum taking on different elements and radiating powerful mana out to the world. These elemental veins can greatly influence surface, geography, climate and creatures above or below ground, the closer to the surface the stronger the corrupting influence.

2.name: Bound Plane of Existence - Faelan
2.content:
Faelan
AKA: Fae, The Fae
Type: Alternate Lumenaria-Bound Dimension
Travel Information: Fae creatures can warp and bring others with them at will in and out of Faelan, though the whimsical dimension is very dangerous for Mortals.
Summary: An entire shard of reality only accessible by the Fae and those rare few allowed to glean the whimsical alterdimension.
There are two courts: The Sleepless Wander, most benevolent Fae fall under this camp, swearing to be a benefit or passive observers of Mortal Kind. And the Arisen, those who see Mortal Kind as competitors to be preyed on for resources and targets for their own fun in causing mayhem and hi-jinks.
Fae creatures include: Gnomes(Half are Good, Half are Evill), Pixie(90% Good/10% Evil), Fae Elf(Fae Bound, Cannot Enter The Mortal Realm, Usually Good.), Sprite(Good, Fragile, Aloof), Brownie(Orderly, Randomly picking houses they like and cleaning them, fighting pests for fun), Banshee(Pure EVIL baring special exception), Pooka(Wildly Mischivous, Takes Animal Forms to play pranks on Mortals and mislead them, especially hunters and poachers.) and many unique legendary creatures.

3.name: Bound Plane of Existence - Hell
3.content:
Hell
AKA: Dra'Karhn(in Mountain Dwarf), Nullen(in Elf)
Type: Alternate Lumenaria-Bound Dimension
Travel Information: The latent magic of Lumenaria disrupts the ability to move in and out of Hell. However, Powerful Demons, Gods, evil sorcerers and other ancient beings can take advantage of the Mana-less gaps to secure travel for themselves or their servants.
Lumenarian Hell is an endless expanse of fire, death, shadow, fear, suffering, and decay. The point of entry for most is the same central area grounded to the Blood Well set deep in the crust of Lumenaria. There are many demonic factions and many kinds of demons. Demon physiology reflects the life psychology of Mortals on Lumenaria such as Demons of Blood, Death, Lust, Jealousy, Mania, Decay and so on.
Hiearchy: Archdemons form when many demons fall under a single demons banner, sometimes in competition with each other, sometimes Archdemons will team up to attack Mortals outside of Hell.

4.name: Continent - Eurudia
4.content:
Name: Eurudia
Type: Continent
Common Language: Eurudian.
Biomes: Mountains, Forests, Beaches, Grasslands, Plains, Swamps, Deep Woods, Desert, Wasteland,
Tech Level:  Common tech is rural villages, magic is used to manifacture solutions Gunpowder weapons exist but are disfavored due to the exist of Combat Arts and Magic, the gap in tech is massive between isolated factions, Mountain Dwarf and Gnomes feircly guarding tech such a Mountain Dwarf Megaton Forges or the Gnome's Manalight from others.
Eurudia is home to many diverse biomes, kingdoms, mortals and demons of all kinds. Kingdoms rise and fall

5.name: Entity Classification - Mortals
5.content:
Mortal
AKA: The Living, Collective Humanity
Type: Life Classification
Summary: A mortal is any living creature with a bound Lumenarian soul, unless a god or powerful presence interferes with the natural process, those that are born are granted a soul from the planet itself and when the body of this soul dies, it returns to the thrumming veins of mana that run through the planet.

6.name: Entity Classification - Servant Undead
6.content:
Sundead
AKA: Servile Undead, Servant Undead
Type: Broad Cultural Dynamic
Summary: Artificial undead are dead creatures of any kind compelled into action magically as tools. Sustained by an external Manaerial source, this could come in many forms but the most common is a Necromancer's capacity for mana. Sundead are considered socially accepted as during the Great Silence, all natural, evil undead were wiped out and the thousands of years since, the use of undead for the good of Mortalkind has transformed public opinion so long as they look presentable to the common person.

7.name: Magic/Super Energy - Demon, Demonic, Hellpower,
7.content:
Demon Magic
AKA: Demon Energy, Demonic Magic, Hellpower, 
Type: Super Energy (Is NOT MAGIC, but a raw energy, an element.)
Summary: A super energy demons of all kinds use to fuel their ungodly powers. From being used for powerful physical talents, terrible spells, or influencing mortals, this power becomes more unstable in areas of high Manaerial Influence. Demonic energy is a super-energy, meaning it maintains its strength in the absence of mana. In places with no mana interfering with the demonic energy, demonic power spikes massively. Many times any wells of blank space with no mana or magical influence running through it, earth, air or water, are often used as focal points for demons to pour through unabated, making area Anti-Magic extremely dangerous.

8.name: Species - Elf
8.content:
Elf
AKA: Eurudian Elf
Type: Species
Lifespan: Can live thousands of years, the oldest known Elf being 3,357 years.
Appearance: Averages 6 Feet, 10 inches Tall. Fair Skin. Colorful Eyes. Long Pointed Ears.
